parse.title: List of first minority male lawyers and judges in California

text.*:
This is a list of the first minority male lawyer(s) and judge(s) in California. It includes the year in which the men were admitted to practice law (in parentheses). Also included are other distinctions such as the first minority men in their state to obtain a law degree or become a political figure.

Contents

  • 1 Firsts in state history
  • 2 Firsts in local history
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

Firsts in state history[edit]

  • John Rollin Ridge (Yellow Bird) (c. 1840s):[1] First Native American (Cherokee) lawyer in California
  • R.C.O. Benjamin (1884):[2][3] First African American male lawyer in California and Los Angeles, California [Los Angeles County, California]
  • Hong Yen Chang (1890):[4] First Chinese American male to obtain a law degree in California, but was denied the right to practice law. He was awarded the right to practice posthumously in 2015.
  • Thomas Pearson (1905):[5] First African American male lawyer to practice in the U.S. District Court in San Francisco, California
  • Chan Chung Wing (1918):[6][7] First Chinese American male lawyer to pass the California Bar exam
  • Edwin L. Jefferson (1931):[8][9] First African American male judge in California (1941)
  • David W. Williams (1937):[10] He was considered "the first African-American federal judge west of the Mississippi" upon his appointment as a Judge of U.S. District Court for the Central District of California (1969).
  • Cecil F. Poole (1939):[11] First African American male to be appointed as the United States Attorney for the Northern District of California (1961) and a Judge of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit (1980)
  • John Aiso (1941):[12][13][14][15] First Japanese American male judge in California (Los Angeles County, California; 1952)
  • Wayne M. Kanemoto (1943):[16][17][18] First Japanese American male judge in Northern California (Santa Clara County, California; 1962). He was also the first Japanese American male lawyer in Santa Clara County, California.
  • Kenji Ito (1945):[19][20][21] First Japanese American male lawyer post-WWII
  • Delbert E. Wong (1948):[22][23][24] First Chinese American male judge in California (Los Angeles County, California; 1959)
  • Arthur Lawrence Alarcon:[25][26] First Latino American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit (1979)
  • Mikio Uchiyama (1953):[27][28][29] First Japanese American male judge in Central California (Fresno County, California; 1968). He was also the first Japanese American male City Attorney for Fowler, California.
  • Wiley Manuel (1954):[30][31] First African American male appointed as a Justice of the California Supreme Court (1977)
  • Earl Ben Gilliam (1957):[32][33] First African American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of California (1980). He was also the first African American male judge in San Diego County, California (1963).
  • Robert Peter Aguilar (1958):[34][35][36] First Latino American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California (1980)
  • Cruz Reynoso (c. 1959):[37] First Latino American male appointed to the California Court of Appeal (1976) and California Supreme Court (1981)
  • Thelton Henderson (1962):[38] First African American male appointed as the Chief Judge of the U.S. District Court of Northern California (1990). He was also the first African American male lawyer in the U.S. Department of Justice: Civil Rights Division.
  • Kenneth Chang (1963):[39] First Korean American male judge in California (1980)
  • Fred W. Gabourie (1965):[40][41][42] First Native American (Seneca people) male judge in California (Los Angeles County, California; 1976)
  • Stephen K. Tamura:[43][44] First Japanese American male appointed as a Judge of the Court of Appeal in California (1966). He was also the first Asian American male (Japanese American) lawyer in Orange County, California.
  • Ronald S. W. Lew (1971):[45][46] First Chinese American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Central District of California (1987)
  • Richard Paez (1972):[47] First Mexican American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Central District of California (1994)
  • Mel Red Recana (1974):[48][49][40] First Filipino American male judge in California (Los Angeles County, California; 1981)
  • Charles Calderon (1976):[50] First Hispanic American male lawyer to become a Senate Majority Leader in California (1996)
  • Garland Ellis Burrell Jr. (1976):[51] First African American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of California (1991)
  • Edward M. Chen (1980):[52][53] First Asian American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California (2011). He is considered the first Asian American male federal district court judge in Northern California's history.
  • Rosendo Peña (1980):[54] First Latino American male appointed as a Judge of the Fifth District Court of Appeal (2012)
  • Jim Humes (c. 1983):[55] First openly LGBT male appointed as a Judge of the California Court of Appeal (2012)
  • Richard T. Fields (1983):[56] First African American male appointed as a Judge of the Fourth District Court of Appeal (2016)
  • Michael W. Fitzgerald (1985):[57][58] First openly LGBT male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Central District of California (2012)
  • Luis A. Lavin (1985):[59] First openly LGBT male appointed as a Judge of the Second District Court of Appeal (2015)
  • M. Bruce Smith (1988):[60] First African American male appointed as a Judge of the Fifth District Court of Appeal (2014)
  • Xavier Becerra (1985):[61] First Latino American male lawyer to be appointed as the Attorney General of California (2017)
  • André Birotte Jr. (1991):[62] First African American male U.S. Attorney for the Central District (2010). He would later become a district court judge.
  • Miguel Marquez (1996):[63] First Latino American male appointed as a Judge of the Sixth District Court of Appeal (2012)
  • Sunil Kulkarni (1996):[64] First South Asian American male judge in Northern California (2013)
  • Vijay Ghandi (1997):[65] First Indian American male judge appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Central District of California (2010)
  • Halim Dhanidina (1997):[66] First Muslim American male judge in California (2012)
  • Vince Chhabria (1998):[67] First Indian American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California (2014)
  • Miguel Márquez:[68] First Latino American male appointed as a Judge of the Sixth District Court of Appeal (2012)

Firsts in local history[edit]

Alphabetized by county name

  • Lionel Wilson (1950):[69][70] First African American male judge in Alameda County, California (1960)
  • Ken M. Kawaichi:[71][72] First Asian American male judge in Alameda County, California (1980)
  • Keith H. Fudenna (1974):[73] First Asian American male appointed as a Judge of the Municipal Court to the Fremont-Newark-Union City Municipal Court (Alameda County, California; 1997)
  • Somnath Raj Chatterjee (1995):[74][75] First South Asian male appointed as a Judge of the Alameda County Superior Court (2017)
  • George Carroll (1954):[76][77] First African American male lawyer in Richmond, California. He would later become the first African American male judge in Contra Costa County, California (1965).
  • Benjamin T. Reyes III (1993):[74][78][79] First Filipino American male appointed as a Judge of Contra Costa County Superior Court (2017)
  • Armando Rodriguez (1965):[80] First Latino American male judge in Fresno County, California (1975)
  • Hugh W. Goodwin (1949):[81][82] First African American male lawyer (c. 1950s) and judge in Fresno County, California (1976)
  • Marco D. Nunez (2002):[83] First openly LGBT male judge in Imperial County, California (2016)
  • Stephen Lachs (1963):[84] First openly LGBT male judge in Los Angeles County, California (1979)
  • Mark Andrew Talamantes (1997):[85] First Latino American male judge in Marin County, California (2012)
  • Albert Maldonado (1974):[86] First Latino American male judge in Monterey County, California (1995)
  • James O. Perez (1956):[87][88] First Latino American male lawyer and judge in Orange County, California
  • Nathaniel Colley (1948):[89] First African American male lawyer in Sacramento, California Sacramento County, California
  • Mamoru Sakuma (1950):[90][91] First Asian American male (Japanese American) judge in Sacramento County, California (1963)
  • Duane E. Bennett:[92][93][94] First African American male to become the City Attorney for Oceanside, California San Diego County, California
  • Harry Low (1955):[95][96] First Asian American male judge in San Francisco County, California (1966)
  • Herb Donaldson (1957):[97] First openly LGBT male judge in San Francisco County, California (1983)
  • Luis Garcia:[98][99] First Latino American male judge in San Francisco County, California
  • Lewis F. Brown (1970):[100][101][102] First African American male lawyer in Solano County, California
  • Osby Davis (1974):[102][103] First African American male lawyer to serve as a Solano County Board of Supervisor (1979-1993) and the Mayor of Vallejo, California (2007)
  • Luis M. Villarreal (1976):[104][105][106] First Hispanic American male to become the youngest Judge of the Solano County Superior Court at the time of his appointment (1982)
  • Charles Edward Aguilar (1962):[107] First Latino American male judge in Stanislaus County, California (1977)
  • Ferdinand P. Inumerable (1994):[108] First Asian American male judge in Ventura County, California (2014)

See also[edit]

  • List of first minority male lawyers and judges in the United States

List of first minority male lawyers and judges in the United States

parse.displaytitle: List of first minority male lawyers and judges in California
